title: Fire safety inspector
overviewOfRole: Assessing the level of fire safety in built environments.

knowledges.detail: The principles of Fire Safety Order and other fire safety legislation, building regulations legislation and British Safety Standards including national guidance and best practice.
How the Fire Safety Order interacts with other legislation, guidance and best practice.
Levels of compliance and how they interact with the Enforcement Management Model and Better Regulation
How to carry out fire safety inspections
Different types of premises, the associated risks and management levels
Fire safety principles for high risk and complex premises and venues, in accordance with recognised guidance
Safeguarding issues and concerns and the actions to take
The different groups and individuals you may interact with as part of your role
How to work with other agencies to enforce fire safety legislation
The different types of formal response and the timescales
Why operational staff need to have valid, reliable and up to date information on premises, where it is stored and how it can be accessed and used
Your role in supporting formal investigations, the actions you can take and when and where to escalate

The legislation, policies and procedures of the organisation and how these affect the role, including data protection, confidentiality, health and safety and lone working plus other relevant organisational policies and procedures
Causes and consequences of unwanted fire signals and deliberate fires
The purpose and role of collaborative partners who can do what, etc. sharing of information and the advances of collaborative working

behaviours.detail: Embraces and values diversity and demonstrates a fair and ethical approach in all situations
Proactively supports change, adjusting approach to meet changing requirements
Maintains a confident, controlled and focused attitude in highly challenging situations
Committed and able to develop self, individuals, teams and others, to improve organisational effectiveness
Understands and applies relevant information to make appropriate decisions and creates practical solutions
Work within own level of authority, responsibility and competence and recognise when to seek support and/or assistance
Applies relevant information to make appropriate decisions and creates practical solutions
Leads others to achieve excellence by the establishment, maintenance and management of performance requirements

skills.detail: Carry out an audit/inspection of complex premises and venues and assess the risks and evaluate the level of fire safety management
To identify and constructively challenge non-compliance
Produce fire safety reports, letters, statutory or non-statutory notices and plans according to organisational policies and procedures
Identify safeguarding issues, such as hoarding, child sexual exploitation, slavery, vulnerability etc. and take appropriate action
Be situationally aware of yourself, others and the environment to ensure safety of all
Interpret and apply the technical knowledge to enforce the Fire Safety Order, such as British Standards, Building Regulations, National Guidance and Best Practice
Work with other agencies, such as local authority building control, approved inspectors, licensing authorities, etc
Demonstrate clear communication skills, with the ability to interact with a wide range of audiences, being persuasive and confident. To communicate complicated information verbally and in writing
Evaluate fire safety design submissions and fire protection systems
To assess fire safety concerns, provide fire safety advice on request and make decisions to instigate improvements as required
Respond to enquiries and requests from other organisations, in accordance with the Primary Authority Scheme

eQAProvider.contactAddress:
Ofqual
Earlsdon Park, 53-55 Butts Road, Coventry, CV1 3BH

involvedEmployers: Fire and Rescue Services: London, South Yorkshire, Shropshire, Dorset and Wiltshire, Hertfordshire, Essex, Merseyside, Nottinghamshire, Surrey, South Wales, Devon and Somerset, Avon, Suffolk, West Midlands, Hants, Royal Berkshire, Cornwall, Cambridgeshire, Tyne and Wear. Training Providers/Others: IFE, XACT, Fire Service College, NFCC
englishAndMathsQualifications: <p>English and maths qualifications must be completed in line with the <a rel="noopener" href="https://www.gov.uk/guidance/apprenticeship-funding-rules" target="_blank">apprenticeship funding rules</a>.</p>
reviewDetails: this apprenticeship will be reviewed in accordance with our change request policy.
clusterDescription: Lead and manage a team providing safety, security, prevention, enforcement, protection and investigation services largely on behalf of society

duties.dutyDetail: Carry out Fire Safety inspections/audits of premises in line with current fire safety legislation
duties.criteriaForMeasuringPerformance: Audits are carried out in line with organisational and legislative requirements

duties.dutyDetail: Enforce Fire Safety legislation in accordance with organisational policy, to include collecting/providing evidence, where appropriate
Gather Operational Risk Information to contribute to the safety of operational staff
duties.criteriaForMeasuringPerformance: Information is gathered according to organisational requirements

duties.dutyDetail: Identify high risk premises, groups and individuals within the community to assist with the implementation of targeted risk-based inspection programmes
duties.criteriaForMeasuringPerformance: In line with organisational policy and procedures

duties.dutyDetail: Examine and respond to consultations and submissions from external stakeholders and provide advice in order to determine compliance with statutory codes of practice and other fire safety related legislation with applicable time constraints. Submissions and consultations could include: planning, building regulations, House(s) of Multiple Occupancy, licencing, marriage venues, etc
duties.criteriaForMeasuringPerformance: Within required timescales following organisational policies and procedures

duties.dutyDetail: Support formal investigations as required by the organisation and take appropriate action
duties.criteriaForMeasuringPerformance: Investigations are carried out following organisational procedures and meet legislative requirements

duties.dutyDetail: Contribute to the policy and procedures that relate to legislative guidance on matters concerning Fire Safety
duties.criteriaForMeasuringPerformance: Contribute information that is accurate and up to date

duties.dutyDetail: Provide technical advice and support on fire safety regulations and guidance documents to internal and external stakeholders
duties.criteriaForMeasuringPerformance: Advice and support is provided clearly and concisely and appropriate to the audience

duties.dutyDetail: Work in accordance with the Primary Authority Scheme
duties.criteriaForMeasuringPerformance: Complies with legislation and organisational policies and procedures

duties.dutyDetail: Provide support and guidance to businesses to reduce unwanted fire signals (e.g. from automatic fire alarms) and deliberate fires
duties.criteriaForMeasuringPerformance: Support and guidance is provided to meet the needs of the business in a timely manner, clearly and concisely

duties.dutyDetail: Collaborate effectively with partner agencies, particularly local regulatory services teams to join up enforcement activities
duties.criteriaForMeasuringPerformance: Share information in accordance with partnership agreements

duties.dutyDetail: Attend internal and external meetings with stakeholders such as Safety Advisory Groups to provide guidance and support with fire safety matters to ensure the safety of the public
duties.criteriaForMeasuringPerformance: Communicate clearly and appropriately to the audience and portray a positive image of your organisation

duties.dutyDetail: Respond to alleged fire risks/complaints and post fire enquiries
duties.criteriaForMeasuringPerformance: Respond in line with agreed timescales and according to organisational policies and procedures and any related legislation
